meanings.definition: To carry or transport (a person or thing) on one's back or shoulders.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was piggybacking on his father during the hike.
meanings.sent2: She piggybacked her little sister to the park.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried piggybacking on the dog, but it didn't go well.
meanings.sent4: The backpack piggybacked on her shoulders as she climbed the mountain.
meanings.sent5: Piggybacking the heavy boxes made him feel like a superhero.

meanings.definition: To use or take advantage of something already in place or existing.
meanings.sent1: The company was piggybacking on the success of their competitor.
meanings.sent2: He piggybacked on his friend's idea to complete his project.
meanings.sent3: The student tried piggybacking on his classmate's test answers, but got caught.
meanings.sent4: Her argument piggybacked on the research findings of the renowned scientist.
meanings.sent5: Piggybacking on the free wifi, she streamed her favorite show without any interruptions.
